intro: Peristeranthus hillii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including white, pink, and purple, and are often used in ornamental horticulture. Peristeranthus hillii thrives in humid, well-drained soils and prefers indirect sunlight.
